newsitem.title: USA: Yahoo! reports smaller-than expected loss.
newsitem.headline: Yahoo! reports smaller-than expected loss.

text.p: Internet search firm Yahoo! Inc. Wednesday reported a smaller-than expected third quarter loss, reflecting sharply higher revenues.

The Santa Clara, Calif.-based company reported a loss of $1.2 million, or 4 cents a share, for the quarter ended in September compared with a loss of $371,000, or 2 cents a share, in the 1995 quarter.
Analysts had expected the company to lose around 7 cents a share in the quarter, according to First Call, which tracks earnings estimates.
Yahoo! had a loss of $1.4 million, or 5 cents a share, in the second quarter on sales of $3.3 million.
Yahoo!, started by two Stanford University students two years ago to help people navigate the World Wide Web, went public in March.

"Our growth in both traffic and revenues is gratifying as we have and will continue to work hard to build a high level of interest and loyalty with Yahoo! users and advertisers alike," President Tim Koogle said.
Yahoo! said its advertiser base grew to 340 advertisers in the third quarter from 230 in the previous quarter.

Yahoo! also reported more than 1 billion "hits" in the quarter ended Sept. 30, giving the company an average of more than 14 million page views a day in September, up from an average of 9 million a day in June.
